intro: Melicoccus antioquensis, commonly known as the Antioquian melicoccus, is a species of flowering plant native to Colombia. It belongs to the family Lythraceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in moist, shaded environments. Its leaves are alternate and lance-shaped, while its fruits are small, capsule-like structures that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and understudied species in botanical research.
